page.title: 12Changing Times 2
page.content: {Before 1945 the village housed only {farm and Estate workers,the few {youngsters independent of the Estate {travelling to Stroud for employment. Farm mechanisation drastically reduced the manpower needed and Estate maintenance was drafted to the local builder.Cottages are now rented to families with business away from the area. A local bus service met the needs of a community totaly dependent on it. Most families now own a car which allows shopping and working further afield. {Until the early 1950's living {conditions were extremely primitive in {most cottages.}A standpipe served several homes.{There was outside {sanitation,no bathrooms and clothes {were washed by hand.
